official_title: Treatment Indications for Breast Cancer-related Subclinical Lymphedema Identified Through a Bioimpedance Surveillance Model
inclusion_criteria:
New diagnosis of breast cancer, Female, 18 years of age or older, Upcoming unilateral axillary lymph node procedure (biopsy or dissection), Able to provide informed consent
Healthy volunteers allowed
Must be FEMALE
Must have minimum age of 18 Years
exclusion_criteria: Pre-existing diagnosis of lymphedema, as diagnosed by physician, History of axillary lymph node procedure, including biopsy, dissection, or radiation to, Pregnancy, Pacemaker or other implanted electrical device, Stage 4-5 kidney disease, Severe liver disease, Active infection, Acute Deep Vein Thrombosis, Unmanaged congestive heart failure or a cardiac event in the past 6 months, Prisoners
